author: sky.cactus
content: I do think we should test the override code path in a public shared testnet at least once before launch.  If that isn't Kintsugi, which testnet should we test on?

author: m.kalinin
content: Kintsugi is not the last iteration of devnets and testnets. We will definitely have another one after the spec freeze

author: m.kalinin
content: If we want overrides to happen via cutting a new release then it would require whitelisted block hash to become a part of a binary distribution. I don't know if it complicates the things or not but worth considering.

author: m.kalinin
content: I put my recent thinking around this issue in the comment here https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/2724#issuecomment-971346284

author: m.kalinin
content:
I am thinking about `feeRecipient`. By following this naming the next step would be to rename `coinbase` to `fee_recipient` in the `ExecutionPayload` on CL and Engine API. The step after this one is to rename `coinbase` to `fee_recipient` on EL which probably doesn't worth the complexity as it also involves JSON-RPC (which names this field as `miner`) and the `COINBASE` opcode.

I am just thinking about renaming `feeRecipient` to `suggestedCoinbase` in the Engine API as the easiest path forward. Though, I don't understand the `coinbase` term hence don't like it, everyone seems to be pretty familiar with the thing it denotes in the context of EL block.

author: sky.cactus
content: When I suggested `feeRecipient`, I assumed it would be named that everywhere in the CL.

author: sky.cactus
content: Why are you naming some things `coinbase` in the CL?

author: sky.cactus
content: This is also a non-consensus change, so EL clients who already have `coinbase` used everywhere are free to leave it as-is if they want.  This naming would just be the name we use in documentation and specifications, and hopefully the name that is used throughout *new* software at least.

author: sky.cactus
content: The CLs already had a concept of "coinbase" prior to this specification?

author: m.kalinin
content: Right, it's in the `ExecutionPayload` and was borrowed from EL a long before the `feeRecipient` suggestion

author: m.kalinin
content: i am worried that CL renaming isn't enough and it will be still called `coinbase` here and there. in this case naming this field in a different way on CL may cause additional confusion

author: jgm
content: We are going to have inconsistencies between the CL and EL now and again.  I'd be inclined to make it fee recipient throughout the CL, with a note in the definition for the execution payload that this is known as "coinbase" on the EL.  We can they worry about tidying it up at a later stage.

author: m.kalinin
content: Currently, we have "beneficiary" in the YP, "coinbase" in CL and EL, "miner" in JSON-RPC, "feeRecipient" in Engine API to denote the same field

author: jgm
content: Of those, fee recipient seems the most accurate and least likely to change with the technology.
